ygData.subject: Re: Shadow Step
ygData.msgSnippet: IT can get ouy out of some nasty situations sometimes, but mostly I think its for PvP and at least a fighting chance to get away, especially in a group.
ygData.messageBody:
IT can get ouy out of some nasty situations sometimes, but mostly I
think its for PvP and at least a fighting chance to get away, especially in
a group. Anything that gets the beast of you for a few seconds allows the
tanks to attempt to drag it back on them.

As for PvP, players respond much slower than mobs (probably because
they don't always know where you are all the time). If you are duelling and
the nasty tank is in your face, you can cast this and usually get enough
time to cast another spell while he reorients, all the while getting beat on
by your pet.

Malark, Karana

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Shadow Panther [mailto:shdwpanther@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 5:17 AM
> To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
> Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Shadow Step
>
>
> From: "Shadow Panther" <shdwpanther@...>
>
>
> I've a question about Shadow Step. I know it's a mini
> random teleport,
> but.. I have some misgivings about it.
>
> I watched another mage, while invisible, casting their Shadow Step
> outside. It was sad, they hardly went a few feet away from
> their original
> spot, and if they were being attacked, they could still get hit by
> whatever it was from where they went.
>
> Though I guess, in a dungeon, it would be more helpful, or
> is that just
> wishful thinking? Also, how long does it take to cast?
> Faster than Gate
> does, or the same?
>
> Thanks for the info folks.
>
> ~Myskyra / Tunare
>
>
